contentrichtext.text: {{Orphan|date=November 2006}} '''Methical''' is an online alias of an unknown [[MMORPG]] player. He created his name in homage to the rapper [[Method Man]] Methical may be one of the most famous success stories within the [[virtual economies]] of MMORPG landscapes. After earning a supposed $100,000, he and two friends became infamous after Methical posted a detailed step by step account of exactly how he found a working [[duping (gaming)|dupe]] in [[Everquest 2]]. The story <ref>{{cite web|url=http://plaguelands.com/?page_id=172 |title=The Best Search Links on the Net |publisher=plaguelands.com |date= |accessdate=2012-09-21}}</ref> became one of the most popular culture reads for the MMORPG communities. The identity of Methical is not known, yet there has been much response from [[Sony Online Entertainment]] as well as several news sources discussing the ramifications of this type of action on [[virtual economies]]. There is some doubt that Methical's account of events is accurate, but it has been confirmed by Sony that basic facts are true. One man basically had a counterfeit money machine within EverQuest 2 and used it to spread currency on every server for what could be a large financial gain. The duping occurred early within the first months of Everquest 2 going live, and Methical was banned within a couple months, netting him a huge profit before he was removed from the game. == External links == *[http://plaguelands.com/?page_id=172 The Original Story] *[http://news.ft.com/cms/s/a1078b90-5299-11da-8d05-0000779e2340.html The Financial Times] *[http://web.archive.org/web/20070301133204/http://videogames.yahoo.com/ongoingfeature?eid=391866&page=0 Yahoo News on Methical] *[http://web.archive.org/web/20080330034011/http://www.gamerdad.com/detail.cfm?itemID=2462 GamerDad.com's Article] *[http://games.slashdot.org/story/05/08/08/205243/selling-virtual-gold-for-fun-and-profit Slashdot's Article] == References == <references /> [[Category:Video game culture]]
